title: Ticket #4246: Add MAX_DEFAULT_LOG for missing MAX_<SUBSYS>_LOG
description:
Currently if you want to increase the log size for all of the daemons, you need to set the MAX_<SUBSYS>_LOG for every daemon. It's easy to fail to set it for a daemon, especially if a new daemon is added later. And in general administrators will want most daemons to use the same value.

Proposed:

MAX_DEFAULT_LOG defaults to "10Mb"

MAX_<SUBSYS>_LOG defaults to $(MAX_DEFAULT_LOG), except for MAX_PROCD_LOG which must be a simple integer.

Our default log files specify only MAX_DEFAULT_LOG and any logs that we have specific reason to want to be a different size (hopefully none).
